channel.title: The New York Times Trends
channel.description: 用中文浏览纽约时报热门报道

item.title:
Breaking News: The hostages who were held by a man at a Texas synagogue for about 11 hours have all been rescued safely, Gov. Greg Abbott said. The suspect died in the standoff.
https://t.co/8VUsyC5sGN

The Covid vaccines now protecting millions of people are the culmination of decades of fundamental discoveries once shrugged off as uninteresting. Scientists never imagined their work would one day come together to tame the pandemic of the century.
https://t.co/ieCZ2JeDFJ

Breaking News: The FBI is at Congregation Beth Israel, a synagogue in Colleyville, Texas, where an official says four people appear to have been taken hostage by a man heard shouting on a livestream.
Follow live updates: https://t.co/VPuNmlYX11
CVS and Walgreens are temporarily closing some stores in the U.S. this weekend because of staff shortages complicated by the soaring number of people infected with Omicron. https://t.co/9WJjzqR8cl
Netflix says "Don't Look Up" is one of its most popular films ever. Some scientists are hoping its success will prompt Hollywood to make more climate focused films. https://t.co/0ubTplsYqW

The underwater volcano that erupted near Tonga was heard some 1,100 miles away in New Zealand. Internet service in Tonga was disrupted, according to The Associated Press, making the extent of injuries and damage difficult to assess. https://t.co/XNXj0tYP5w
This large, fluffy pancake, first featured in The New York Times for Mardi Gras in 1983, is excellent for breakfast, brunch, lunch and dessert. https://t.co/TWx9NASh3v https://t.co/OT3ojt9Ah5

The CDC conceded on Friday that cloth masks won't protect Americans against the coronavirus as effectively as surgical masks or respirators. In East Asia, where people have worn surgical masks in public for years, it was already common knowledge. https://t.co/Wwa54MIen1
This modern take on a classic hot toddy can be a comforting way to celebrate staying warm on a cold winter night. https://t.co/2U4ftDDWCv https://t.co/n5Xhdt9PO0

A newly disclosed memo circulated among top census officials cites "unprecedented" interference by the Trump administration in the 2020 count, including political pressure on a crash program seeking to identify and count unauthorized immigrants. https://t.co/2lvYdMD0gL

The right-wing channel One America News Network — which has spread conspiracy theories about the 2020 election, the Capitol riot and the safety of coronavirus vaccines — will be dropped by DirecTV, one of its largest distributors, later this year. https://t.co/lTSwnPBy8G

Novak Djokovic has done potentially irreparable harm to his own image, writes Michael Steinberger in @NYTMag. "It is a sad coda to what is widely considered the greatest era in the history of men’s tennis." https://t.co/1vvszDOZ3I

A four-foot tsunami wave was reported to have hit Tonga’s capital on Saturday, sending people rushing to higher ground. The U.S. National Tsunami Warning Center issued a tsunami advisory for the Washington and Oregon coast on Saturday morning Pacific time. https://t.co/L0JK17OkJt

About 8,400 grocery workers went on strike at 80 Kroger-owned King Soopers stores in Colorado, after nearly two years on the front lines. They are seeking higher wages, better personal protection equipment and improved public safety measures in stores. https://t.co/syBjsiGI4P
This large, fluffy pancake, first featured in The New York Times for Mardi Gras in 1983, is excellent for breakfast, brunch, lunch and dessert. https://t.co/MH4djmWmGF https://t.co/5G1OpNTbKW

Common bottlenose dolphins have sex frequently — very likely multiple times in a day. A close examination of 11 clitorises from female dolphins suggests they experience pleasure during frequent sexual activity. https://t.co/mf1bFFVQAi
In this vegan take on an iconic Chinese American stir-fry, cauliflower steps in for the chicken. https://t.co/9hAqUFc0JL https://t.co/sNVkVWVT30

Beatrice Mintz, a cancer researcher who discovered that nearby tissue could help tame tumor cells without the use of harsh treatments like chemotherapy and radiation, died on Jan. 3. She was 100. https://t.co/eRYqOwPai3

Novak Djokovic’s lawyers went to court to challenge the second cancellation of his Australian visa. They plan to file an appeal, but the tennis star will likely be taken back into immigration detention on Saturday.
Read highlights from the hearing. https://t.co/UuRO9AEaG8

Navient, once one of the largest student loan servicing companies in the U.S., reached a deal to forgive $1.7 billion in debts for nearly 66,000 borrowers and pay $95 million to settle claims of predatory lending. https://t.co/HRyCqrNml1 https://t.co/x5pYwsO6H6
Breaking News: For the first time, the CDC said cloth masks weren’t as effective as other options. “Wear the most protective mask you can,” the agency urged. https://t.co/zOIRim0WQZ
Martin Shkreli, the executive who raised the price of a life-saving drug, was ordered to repay $64.6 million and barred for life from the drug industry. https://t.co/yTrclyeDou

The House Jan. 6 panel subpoenaed four major social media companies — Alphabet, Meta, Reddit and Twitter — criticizing them for allowing extremism to spread on their platforms and saying they have failed to cooperate adequately with the inquiry. https://t.co/WCgG6QqBoH

"Many Australians saw in Djokovic’s actions both dishonesty and a disregard for others," writes @damiencave. "Some questioned whether he had really tested positive in the first place, given the convenient timing for his vaccination exemption." https://t.co/e0hahLQkfv

Breaking News: The Treasury Department warned Arizona officials that it could claw back pandemic relief money if the state does not stop ​undercutting mask requirements in schools. https://t.co/RLGXb5EkuN
Breaking News: Americans will be able to order free rapid coronavirus tests online beginning on Wednesday, U.S. officials said. The tests should ship within 7 to 12 days. https://t.co/jlnx5daMZC

Breaking News: The Ohio Supreme Court struck down a congressional map skewed to favor Republicans, ruling it was the equivalent of a dealer stacking the deck, and sent it back to state lawmakers to try again. https://t.co/QANVHZzPPI

The film “Encanto” might have cautioned against talking about Bruno, but a whole lot of people are obsessed with a song about him.
Here’s how Disney created “We Don’t Talk About Bruno,” its biggest smash since “Let It Go.” https://t.co/20qipDU1Ax
Breaking News: The U.S. accused Russia of sending saboteurs into Ukraine to stage “a false-flag operation” that would create a pretext for Moscow to invade. https://t.co/wiSXuzwhgO

Hackers brought down several Ukrainian government websites, posting a message on the Foreign Ministry's site saying, “Be afraid and expect the worst.”
The cyberattack came a day after high-stakes talks intended to forestall a Russian invasion. https://t.co/TsVEKC8TW3

The famed Southernmost Point Buoy in Key West, Florida, was set afire by a pair of men on New Year’s Day. Two suspects were identified by their bartender, who said he remembered them because they didn’t tip. https://t.co/SboFAuQhwU

Australia’s prime minister defended the decision to cancel Novak Djokovic’s visa again.
“Australians have made many sacrifices during this pandemic, and they rightly expect the result of those sacrifices to be protected,” he said. https://t.co/iCofIY2F6w

Novak Djokovic had his visa revoked for a second time by the Australian authorities.
The decision was made on the grounds of “health and good order,” the country’s immigration minister said, adding that it was in the public interest to do so. https://t.co/S2eBBSRgkg

Pregnant women with Covid are more likely to lose their fetuses and babies in the womb or shortly after birth, new research shows. "Quite strikingly, no baby deaths occurred in women who had SARS-CoV-2 and were vaccinated," the paper's first author said. https://t.co/pngQ9X7Bfs

Novak Djokovic had his visa revoked for a second time by the Australian authorities.
Australia’s immigration minister said in a statement that he was canceling the tennis star’s visa on the grounds of "health and good order." https://t.co/8g0CI6lNJh https://t.co/4QQrVh7M0g
Breaking News: Australia revoked Novak Djokovic’s visa again, another twist in a drawn-out drama over his refusal to be vaccinated against Covid-19. https://t.co/o6uD8RPplP

Nicholas Alahverdian, a suspect in a 2008 rape in Utah said to have died in 2020, turned up at a hospital in Glasgow, where he had been placed on a ventilator with Covid-19, the authorities said. https://t.co/8aVSaTLX0O

A Maryland man who received a pig’s heart last week in a pioneering transplant procedure has a criminal history stemming from an incident 34 years ago in which he repeatedly stabbed a young man, leaving him paralyzed. https://t.co/Ha8m0RsbUD

Clyde Bellecourt, a founder of the American Indian Movement who led protests in the 1970s at Wounded Knee and in Washington over the U.S. government’s grim record of broken treaty obligations, died on Tuesday at his home in Minneapolis. He was 85. https://t.co/SJsS1mjTv2 https://t.co/MjvFJ76CL2

President Biden plans to announce the deployment of 1,000 military medical personnel to Michigan, New Jersey, New Mexico, New York, Ohio and Rhode Island to help hospitals deal with a surge in Omicron cases, White House officials said. https://t.co/BIEv5VeDqY

Inflation is higher than it has been in decades. What does it mean for you? @jeannasmialek will pose reader questions to @MaryDalyEcon, president of the Federal Reserve Bank of San Francisco, on Friday at 11 a.m. ET. Join us for the conversation. @sffed https://t.co/qxz7pAsLoc

Breaking News: Teachers in France staged a walkout to protest changing Covid testing rules that they say are now too lax to protect against Omicron.
The country is averaging nearly 300,000 new Covid cases a day, far more than at any earlier point. https://t.co/nu2nI9w33M
Breaking News: The Supreme Court blocked President Biden’s vaccine-or-testing mandate for large employers, but allowed a requirement for health care workers. https://t.co/Tg5FiVPd85

Breaking News: Stewart Rhodes, the leader and founder of the Oath Keepers militia, was arrested and charged with seditious conspiracy in connection with the Capitol riot, officials said. https://t.co/OINKubKTgW

Breaking News: Prince Andrew has given up his military titles and royal charities, Buckingham Palace said, a stinging rebuke by the British royal family a day after a New York judge allowed a sexual abuse case against him to go ahead. https://t.co/x88Gc5EOYN

More than 100 leading American doctors and scientists have signed an open letter in support of Dr. Anthony Fauci, calling Republican attacks on him “inaccurate, unscientific, ill-founded in the facts and, increasingly, motivated by partisan politics.” https://t.co/XQGuoM6VfE

Jonny Greenwood achieved global fame in Radiohead before starting to score films. Now, with 11 scores to his name, including “The Power of the Dog” and “Spencer,” he’s proven it’s no mere side hustle. https://t.co/GRjfDuwtz5

Breaking News: Navient, once one of the largest student loan servicing companies in the U.S., reached a deal to forgive $1.7 billion in debts for nearly 66,000 borrowers and pay $95 million to settle claims of predatory lending. https://t.co/G68evPaCDW
Breaking News: The Republican National Committee is preparing to require presidential candidates to not participate in debates run by the long-established commission. https://t.co/KpkOKAQjOB

Shirley McGreal, who became a formidable voice against man-made misery suffered by primates, died at age 87. She exposed smuggling rings and research laboratories and built a sanctuary for gibbons in South Carolina. https://t.co/xr0JpXhhLI
